abstract: News Analysis; West remains divided over Russia's actions in Ukraine, with little confidence that February cease-fire agreement will hold; major disagreements still exist over how to avoid inflaming situation and thus providing justification for further Russian intervention.
lead_paragraph: Western diplomats and analysts are predicting a further escalation of tensions, possibly including the placement of Russian nuclear weapons in the annexed Crimean Peninsula.

headline.main: Fragile Cease-Fire in Ukraine Inspires Little Confidence in West
headline.print_headline: Fragile Cease-Fire in Ukraine Inspires Little Confidence in West

snippet: Western diplomats and analysts are predicting a further escalation of tensions, possibly including the placement of Russian nuclear weapons in the annexed Crimean Peninsula.
